Very smooth mouthfeel.  Lots of fruit juice flavors, and not just grapefruit.  Pineapple, apple, white grape and something darker.  Burnt caramel and molassas sweetness.  As it warms it mellows into the perfect, seamless balance of hop bitterness and malt sweetness.  You are vaguely aware of the alcohol until you go to stand up.  A truely great beer.
This beer is great.. It will get you fucked up very quick..

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2009 Gorgeous Munich malt, pineapple, and alcohol aromas. Softly carbonated.   From beginning to end the flavors are absolutely immense - chock full of pineapple and bready malts to accompany whispers  of chocolate and leather before finishing with drops of banana and rubbery textured alcohol.  The alcoholic finish is borderline astringent and thus my only complaint.  Otherwise a brilliant example. Re-rate: What was once a shining example of brutishness and finesse, is now a flabby alcoholic underattenuated joke of a beer. Last good batch was 2004 which is when it was lusciously malty with bright and juicy hops. Undrinkable anymore.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: I finally got a hold of the double.  There¬ís no secret here, this one will fuck you up.  I want to get one of those big ass gallon size giant bottles.
Tropical fruit,coconut hoppy aroma.Sweet fruity pinapple, mango peach flavors balanced by medium hops.Hid the alcohol very well. It was actually smoother to drink than regular bastard.
12/2/02:  very nice color.  not much head.  pleasant, sweet nose.  sweet to the taste and lighter tasting than i expected.

*2002 edition*
Nice deep red color with a diminshing, tan head. Minimal lacing.
Lots of sweetness in the nose with tiny hint of hops.
Malt and syrup in the flavor. Could have used a few more IBU to balance all of the malt.
High alcohol is masked well.
Impressive beer.
I¬ím sure a higher rating would be warranted if I had this on tap. AB is better on tap too.

This beer rocks.
The aroma is very malty with huge notes of pineapple, evergreen, earth and alcohol.
A beautiful beer!!!
Sparkling clear ruby hue. Large, beige, frothy head with decent lacing. Mostly diminishing.
The flavor is very malty and syrupy-sweet up front. Moderately bitter and lightly pungent on the backside. Strong hop presence and warm alcohol throughout. There¬ís not as much actual flavor as I expected from a highly rated Stone beer, especially since I was taunted on the back of the bottle.
Full-bodied with an oily mouthfeel. Light carbonation. Long, bitter, dry finish.
Hey, this is a good, not great beer. Not as good as many beers rated far below it... I guess you would call that the Stone Factor. I was a little disappointed. Hey, the score I gave it ain¬ít bad even though this bottle was one of Stone¬ís weaker offerings. This actually says a lot about Stone Brewing as a leader within the craft-brewing industry.

Beautiful red, flashy and delicious beer. I drank it out of a large wine type glass which complemented it nicely. Fine lined lace around the rim of glass. This is a slap in the face beer and beautiful to look at.  The only that soured my rating was a little stuffed up nose which led to a satisfactory aroma rating. Maybe I¬íll re-rate it on a better day. Definitely a worthy beer for a worthy drinker.

Ahh...I feel satisfied by the Bastard.  Beautiful amber appearance, strong head and a powerful aroma filled with maltiness, hops, and yeast.  Flavor is very hoppy, the spiciness of them lasting long after the beer has gone down the throat.  This is a strong beer that demands respect.  The flavor changes as it warms in your mouth.  A well hopped yet well balanced recipe.  I might buy another bottle and let it age for a few years.  There are definite possibilities...  Just try it and you won¬ít be let down.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2008 2001 edition sampled 7/5/02: Fruity/alcohol aroma, flat transparent brown which was sort of metallic, fruity esters jump out at first followed by overpowering alcohol and a mellow tartness...alcohol kicks your ass but hoppy fruitiness keeps the alcohol in check till the end where it comes back and sucker punches you in the back of the head..the alcohol is too strong and I couldn¬ít finish the whole bottle..as the beer warmed a more subtle burnt sugar/carmel flavor came out... 2002 edition:  hoppy necatarines injected with alcoholic heroin..creamy hops and solid backbone malts ride along on this magnificant rollercoaster ride from hell..either my tastes have changed or this batch is a few steps up from last years...gOodie goodies.  rerate 2006- 2008 Not as good as it used to be, i dont think.

Appealing fruity, lightly berryish malty aroma, along with a whiff of alcohol and citric hop.  Clear, bright red color with a rather slight head and little visible effervescence.  Flavor has a nice balance of sweetly fruity malt, piney, lightly citrusy hop and warming alcohol.  The malt is present in enough quantity to render the lip of the glass sticky with sweetness, while the generous hop addition provides an omnipresent yet pleasant bitterness, both in flavor and palate.  Aftertaste is alcoholic and spicy, and finish is long, drawn out and hoppy.  I would drink this on a regular basis if I could find it here.  Hits the spot!

UPDATED: APR 8, 2003 2002 edition  - deep orange, big head and excellent lacing.  Taste is thick and smooth. From begining til end, the strong assertive flavors battle it out in my mouth.  Sweeter than expected malts and a nice huge bitterness.

ok...first off, I was really drunk when I was able to drink this one, First was:Chimay Bleu,Sierra Nevada Celebration ale,ayinger,some kinda lambic style beer, trois pistoles, then the double bastard, I have another big bottle so I¬íll probabley rerate this beer. From what I remember it had a nice head, and smelled like alcohol, it seemed to taste very good, but Im gonna drink again just to get a good rating out of it.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2003 2002:Dark,oarnge with a decent,short-lived,head.Huge fruity,sweet,aroma.Alcohol is also evident in aroma but not as much as I expected.Palate is soft and smooth and silky.Well balanced sweet malt and juicy hop flavors explode in the mouth.Malts in the front and a hoppy,spicy-alcohol finish. Finishing a bottle is a challenge. One well made dirty,evil bastard.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2004 Smells, looks and tastes like the Arrogant Bastard! Good thing I like that beer hugh! Tastes identical except for a more pronounced abv. (4.0) re-rate 1/13/04: 2003 bottling. While I can't say that this is unenjoyable, I don't know if I've ever had a brew that hides it's alcohol so poorly. This is only 10% but it tastes higher in abv than the 120 min. IPA from DFH. A good beer but I wish they had maybe fermented it at a lower temp. or conditioned it longer in the secondary. I would bet thei has a really low F.G. Oh well, I've got a 2002 sitting in my cellar and I'll probably open it next year and report back. (3.5) re-rate(1/25/04) I couldn't wait to try the 2002 and man what a difference a year makes. This beer mellows out so nicely that it would be hard to call it the same beer. Hop oils have retired a bit and the flavors have melded together very nicely. This was a good brew,... age it for a year and it is downright phenominal.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2004 17 Nov 2004: drinking a 2003 DB: Still excellent, great sweet flavor w/ a hop finish, nice aroma. A world class brew.

2002 Rating: beautiful red color, almost a fruity nose, malt up front, hoppy finish, beautifully balanced. A masterpiece


20001 Rating:If you like bitter, this is the beer. It¬ís a bit too bitter for me.
However, surprisingly, it finishes rather smoothly. Definitely woth trying.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2004 Release 2003: 
On the pour a translucent deep garnet color and the head portly in size and spumescent in texture, the color a toothsome light tan with the resultant lace a satiny veil to obscure the glass. The aroma of the hop flowers quite evident along with the fusel alcohol, malt sweet at the back, fresh and a portent of things to come this nose, start is ambrosial, rich in malt with the top a full in its feel. Finish is perky in its acidity, the hops omnipotent and the 10 percent ABV instantly warms the tummy, droughty aftertaste that maintains the bitterness alcohol and hops to the very last. One of the beers I wait for each year, a six pack for the fridge, and a case for the cellar.
Release 2002: 
On the pour a crystal clear deep Sanguineous color with the head majestic in size and frothy in texture with the lace a thick glutinous sheet. Nose is malt; hop floral, caramel, hints of butter and light fusel alcohol tones. Front is ambrosial, the top middling, the finish is devastatingly hopped, peacefully acidic, the aftertaste is beastly alcohol bitter, a major league ¬ìBelly Warmer to boot". Oh God, how I love this magisterial brew, it¬ís a Jekyll and Hyde beer, good at the start, brutal at the finish.
Release 2001: 
Pours a deep ruby color, reddish-beige head, and tons of lace. Nose is buttery, sweet, hints of brown sugar, and traces of hops. Begins malt sweet, the top is full, the carbonation moderate, slightly acidic, the finish loaded with hops, dry and bitter, and the 10 percent ABV warms the tummy. Another great beer from this most magnificent brewery, but as they say "Not Meant For Everyone", so beware!

ODDB- Old Double Dirty Bastard, as soon as I poured it in the glass it challenged me to a fight, daring me to take that first sip, its ODDB Vs. Me. It looks Dark, deep and thick,a hint of Burgandy color. This is one evil Ale. WHAM I just swallowed some of it and the battle is on ,complex flavours of citrus,hops, spice, plums, raisins, brown sugar and malt are an awesome display of a brewing masterpiece. This one knocked me down but I recovered and finished the fight, Highly Recommended !
Im worthy. This dank beer was a complex crazy assortment of flavors I cant even begin to understand.  This beer is Awesome! --(thanks Jcalabre)
Thick and syrupy, good flavor.  High alcohol taste with brown sugar tones.  It made my eyes water a little!

Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. This beer is knock-your-socks-off strong. Who is worthy indeed? Lively, complex and fervent flavors throughout. A great dessert beer and another winner from Stone.

A dark red color with a decent sized head.  The aroma is strongly of sweet malt and not too unlike a barley wine.  The flavors are intense and very full.  Toffee, caramel, and sweet malt.  A surprising hop bitterness finishes it all off.  Certainly different, but very enjoyable.
whoa what an ale, this is fantastic rich,strong body with fruity tones definately strong and not for the light hearted but for the person who enjoys a good beer,here it is bottoms up

This is a very strong beer.  I think that it¬ís technically a liqueur or if it¬ís not it should be.  Very tasty Bitter and sweet at beginning with bitterness fading at the end of the bottle.  Sweetness staying strong, maybe a little too strong throughout the end.  Great texture and aroma.  Very intense and not a good beer for beginners.
wow. This one is loaded with complex flavor. Lots of enjoyable sweet flavors of pine, fig and molsassas-like notes. This is like a winter ale and should be sipped to be thoroughly enjoyed.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2006 Rating #1 Bottle (8 4 8 4 18).  A rich mahogany with a laced light brown head.  The nose releases a forest of dark fruits, malts, pine, and sweet sugars.  A thick coating body that releases the flavors in a long drawn out burst.  Rating #2 Bottle (8 4 8 4 18).  A red mahogany color with a lush light brown head.  An assertive nose and impressive flavor.  Such a great full-bodied beer with loads of hops.
best beer i¬íve ever had!!!!!!!!

2001 version Deep ruby color. Medium head. Aroma is malty with a hint of brown sugar and fruit. WOW!! This is one %#)$ of a big beer. A FULL Bodied Strong Ale. Big and Bold. This beer‚Äôs malts and hops reach out and grab you places you may not what to be grabbed. Flavor is full and complex. Brown sugar, molasses, hop spiciness, grapefruit and .. are all here, and assault your taste buds. This is one kick-ass beer. Not for the timid. Taste is thick, somewhat chewy and a little high alcohol oily. Mouthfeel is full, round and expansive. Finish is clean and surprisingly smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter and warming. The 10% alcohol gets to you after a bit, nice and warming. AMAZING beer, not for everyone, most will ‚ÄúNOT BE WORTHY‚Äù ..

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2005 22 oz capped bottle (2002 release, fresh): Sweet sugar plums dance from an off white head that rests atop a deep garnet body.  Hints of brown sugar and raisins entice the taste buds to dive in further and just when you reach the edge of sweetness, hops mix with some spice. . . then, just as you feel you may have this one figured out, the alcohol slams you in the face and reminds you who is in charge. . . The Double Bastard. . .then I wonder - is that so bad?  8/4/8/4/16

22 oz capped bottle (2004 release, sampled December 2005): voluminous tan marshmallow head that slowly diminishes and leaves a lattice work of sticky lace.  Dark caramel candy aroma with hop resin and astringent grapefruit esters.  Brilliant, clear ruby-plum.  Smooth, though thick mouth feel with hop grist and pulverized pine needles tickling the tongue.  I think that I liked the fresher sample a bit better ¬ñ more flavours and not quite as sour or bitter.   7/3/7/4/14
2002 edition.Aroma is like smelling a grapefruit. First sip is a hop assault but somehow there is enough malt to level it a little bit. Balance it¬ís not but it helps.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2005 It¬ís an amazing beer beer.  My wife likes lagers, she thought it was too "hoppy".  I like hops and I thought it was pretty good, but I wished there were a little more "hops".  In retrospective, I think its a big beer with both plenty of hops and malt.  I hope more comes this way. Cheers!

Update: 10/10/2001 - Rating of a 2001 Vintage Double BastardAbsolutely amazing beer that has gotten better with age.  There is a slight head and a faint fruity aroma to start the drink.  The color is a dark-magenta with an amazing bite after the first sip.  The alcohol content is high, but so are the flavors.  The hops accentuate the fruity flavor as this beer tickles the taste buds.  A true delight that has gotten better with age.  A very fine brew that has jumped up my beer ratings chart with age.  Had on tap at Callhan¬ís 10/09/02.Rating from Early 2001 - new vintage beerDefinitely not for everyone, this beer jumps out and hits you hard.  The hops are strong and the alcohol high.  Not for the timid, this is twice as good as the name suggests.
Take Arrogant Bastard Ale, hold everything else constant, and double the malt.  No aroma to speak of.  Chocolate-caramel malt flavor, very noticeable alcohol.  Very stong beer.

Has gotten alot better with age. Deep ruddy color and a thick oily head that left laceing all sown the glass. Lots of grain and hops in the nose along alcohol.  Nearly sweet malt coats the tounge for a very thick mouthfeel with a fair amount of hop bitterness.  Has lost alot of abraisiveness and remains surprizingly smooth
I want to say that the hop bite is too strong, but there is an underlying smoothness on the bottom end that keeps me from going there.  Also, the 10% ABV is hardly noticed HEY MALHEUR et al...

This one has gotten better with age. I have had a case aging for a while now and it is still great.  When i had it fresh the flavor was too busy.  but after aging for a while the flavors mellow together, they dont go away they just mature.  very tangy with fruity esters and lots of alcohol.  the hops give good fruitiness.  I cant wait to open another bottle in a month.
what the arrogance should have been.  the higher alcohol works so much better than the lower levels in AB.  beautiful nose, rich caramel color and outstanding flavor
Sampled the Oregon Brewers Festival 7/27/02.  Minimal head, and a slightly cloudy brown color.  Alcohol in the nose, and a bitey, tang flavor.  Definately kicks butt.
Full, tangy taste. Not for the timid.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2004 7/3/02: First impression: Over rated, over arrogant and over priced. Having said that...it¬ís not a bad brew.  Re-rate 11/27/04:  Pours a rich cherry/mohogany color with a small light tan head. Nose is sweet with a wiff of alcohol. Flavor starts rich and barleywine sweet followed by the hop bitterness that lingers in a light orange rind aftertaste.  Palate is rich and smooth. Alcohol warms the face.

Pours with a small creamy head, on a clear dark ruby body. Plum-like aroma with a lot of NW hops. Syrupy mouthfeel, big dark fruit taste that ends with an explosion of hops. You could probably age one of these for several years. The 10% in a 22OZ bottle may make this an early night for me. Thanks Gusler!

damn damn damn damn....
This was quite a beer. ABA on steroids

This really is Arrogant bastard x2.  Everything is just intesified.  Very similiar to the original barleywine.  This thing really comes at you.  Sweet malty start, full middle, bitter finish.  Complex all the way through.

I have to admit to being a fan of both the barley wine
style and of Stone Brewing.  It is not a surprise therefore, that
I took great pleasure in imbibing Stone¬ís Double Bastard.  The 
experience begins with a delicous aroma.  A strong malt sweetness
is followed by a light hop bitterness finished with a mellow sweet
aftertaste.  This is clearly a beer of many elements.  I am only happy
to try and discover all of them.
Rich, fulfilling beer.  Nicely balanced, as the abundantly fragrant hops are kept in check by the nutty, caramelly malt.

This is one intense beer! Lives up to the warning and is twice the bastard of the original...Deep glowing red, complex aroma floral, fruity, spicey, sit down before you take a sip, flavor is amazing, Sweet malty ness balances the tons if hops added givng this beer a spicey sweet flavor, hints of pineapple/grapefruit in finish. Complex and not for the daliy bud drinker!

Liquid Arrogance?  More like Liquid Fury!  A distinctly stronger brew than the first Arrogant Bastard, I gave this one a 2 in the Palate, just because I¬ím honestly not sure I could handle two in a row.  This beer has lots of everything: very malty with hints of chocolate and other tastes my palate is not sophisticated enough to understand, lots of carbonation, lots of hops, and a DARK red color that is scarey!  If you aren¬ít a hop-head, beware of this beer, and Stone¬ís other brews!  Quite simply, you¬íre not qualified to apprechiate it.  What a great beer . . .

Deep russet ruby color; Head was firm with good lace; Aroma was esthery/grapey-bubblegum. Alcohol is very eveident- went STRAIGHT to my head. Lots of malt balnced well with the huge amount of hops- they played well together. Stayed very grapey through the glass, which I found strange. ¬íPalate Destroyer¬í is definitely a proper nickname for this one!

Double Arrogant Bastard, a.k.a. ¬íPalate Destroyer.¬í This is a very serious beer... a 10% ABV barleywine style ale. The nose is sugary, featuring some toffee scents and some slightly floral and woody notes. This thick, almost viscous ale enters with sweetness as it first touches the tongue, but then attacks the palate with an intense bitterness. Finish is long, with a sustained bitter attack. IBU around 75-80 according to the brewer.

Light reddish-brown; aroma of dying embers, toffee, cherry cheesecake, earthy hops; this is thick! thick! thick!.  Similar flavour profile to Bastard but a lot bigger; dry finish with the highest Lovibond crystal malts involved.

Deep ruby red/copper. Thin head and lace. Nose of complex malts,chocolate,caramel, and slight fruitiness. Very inviting. Medium to almost slightly thick bodied, chewy malt palate, sweet with fruity impressions,along with  caramelized brown sugar make a damn tasty,full flavored and rich brew. Then you swallow and the hoppy bitterness explodes in your mouth, drying it and begging you to take another sip of this bad ass MF¬íer and to do it all over again. Awesome balance. These guys dont play around, I cannot wait to try the ther other offerings. Gusler...thank you my man!

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2004 Sweet and malty nose; very fresh-smelling and inviting. Ruby red color. Huge hop boquet. Smooth & sugary. Strong and rather intensely flavored. Earthy, grassy, warm, wholesome, rounded and complex. Heavy mouthfeel. Shovels of tasty hops... but gentle, in a way. Not overly bitter. 'Different,' but very enjoyable.

The label for this beer is hysterical. It pretty much says you are not worthy of this beer. It is a fine beer that isn¬ít for the ¬íless experiecned¬í. Not the beer to give your Bud drinking friends. Great hoppiness, almost a grapefruit-like bitterness.
A strong ale. I only had it off tap, but my impressions are that it¬ís a more refined version of the regular Arrogent Bastard. Slightly less bitter, and sweeter hints of maple.

Wow!  This is a great beer, how do they keep making these wonderful beers?  Can¬ít wait to get back to Nocal - I have one in the cellar and one day I¬ím going to invite a bunch of friends (I¬ím working in Maine, God) and allow them a taste and then finish it myself.  This is meant to be shared.

Now if your looking for a beer with a major kick you MUST try this one. It¬ís strong in content and best of all filled with rich taste. The double isn¬ít around always so pick it up when it is. A must try beer!

This is a great brew by stone.would give it even higher marks but i want stone to keep up the great work.just finished my last double for the 2000 batch and it was even better with a little age.also make sure you drink this at close to room temp.and you¬íll enjoy it!!
I like arrogant bastard much better. Even though the higher alcohol content, its not nearly as good....

It¬ís Arrogant Bastard¬ís bigger, nastier brother.  A massive load of hops balanced with an equitable load of malts.  With the 10% ABV, ¬íbastard¬í is an appropriate term.  What differentiates this from Arrogant Bastard most is the texture of it, as it¬ís richer and creamier with the Double.  Very nice brew for those who want 22 oz. of it at a time.
well it is good, but it has a taste found in many other beers. still not as good as its big brother the original bastard

As is typical for Stone; this has the big malt, big hops combination.  Bold toasty malt flavor similar to ¬íregular¬í Bastard.  Big citrus and grassy hop aroma, flavor and accompanying bitterness.  Biggest difference from Bastard is the alcohol, which is noticable in flavor.  Same color and head as Bastard.  Good.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2011 Cloudy brown-amber, fine off white foam, bushy herbal bracing hops, bitter caramels, slightly buttery, hints of anise. Apparent alcohol, warming and cutting through the creamy feel of the body. Interesting to revisit -- a see lot in my old rating that rings true while I¬íve got a different perspective now a decade later. The nearest comparison I¬íve had is probably from Hair Of The Dog. Thanks, LagunitasFan!


Initial Rating Date: 12/24/2001 3:52:33 AM Cloudy amber. Rich caramels, lots of malt aroma with some new tinge of yeastiness, alcohol pepper and feel, and smack your ass dry hopping getting you in the end. The 10% 22 oz. bottle definitely packs a whallop.  Again, good stuff.
